definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: It seemed obvious that China was rehearsing for next year.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，中国似乎是在为明年的奥运会进行彩排。

sentences.english: On late Saturday night, there is a full dress rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 在周六晚上，有一个全晚装彩排。

sentences.english: Larry and Alan are watching the rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 赖瑞和阿伦正在看彩排。

sentences.english: But the rehearsal time is so early that I could not get to the square.
sentences.chinese: 但是彩排的时间太早了啊，我赶不到呢。

sentences.english: The Colonel's Review is a dress rehearsal for the Trooping the Colour ceremony
sentences.chinese: 上校检阅仪式是授旗仪式的一次彩排。

sentences.english: Non-participation at the rehearsals and the gala concert results in loss of the prize.
sentences.chinese: 不参加彩排和庆典音乐会的选手将失去奖项。

sentences.english: I actually just came from a rehearsal for my directing class.
Life on earth is just the dress rehearsal before the real production.
sentences.chinese: 人生在世，其实只是彩排，为未来公演之日作准备。

sentences.english: Rehearsals, as you see, are under way, for a new production of Chalumeau's "Hannibal".
sentences.chinese: 诸位请看，我们正在彩排夏卢莫的新剧《汉尼拔》。

sentences.english: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.
sentences.chinese: 世界是座舞台，但大多数人都没有彩排。

sentences.english: Eric and EO2 did rehearsal for "Jade Singers Celebrate TVB's Anniversary".
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威与EO2为《翡翠歌星贺台庆》彩排。

sentences.english: The fireworks show displayed during the rehearsal was especially spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 彩排期间上演的烟花表演特别壮观。

sentences.english: On Saturday there is a rehearsal, and every single presenter shows up.
sentences.chinese: 周六有一次彩排，每位演员都会单独出现。

sentences.english: One of the joys ofworking on a musical is that you rehearse for two months.
sentences.chinese: 参与歌舞片的一大乐事在于，要彩排两个月。

sentences.english: We need to have several rehearsals so we don't make any mistakes during the final performance.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止在正式演出时出岔子，我们彩排了好多遍。

sentences.english: They will then take part in a dress-rehearsal countdown a few days later.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，他们将会进行一个倒计时彩排。

definition: (of an actor, athlete etc) to prepare to make one's entrance/to wait in the wings
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
announce the items on a (theatrical) program
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
abbr. for 春節聯歡晚會|春节联欢晚会[Chun1 jie2 Lian2 huan1 Wan3 hui4]
